title: traffic_anomaly
label: Traffic Anomaly
description: Monitors and alerts on unusual network traffic patterns that deviate from established baselines, indicating potential security threats or anomalies.

message.example: Detected anomalous network traffic pattern on firewall FW-CORP-ASA-01 (192.168.1.254). Source host DESKTOP-7A8B9F3C initiated a high volume of outbound connections to multiple external IPs over a 30-second period, exceeding the established baseline by 450%. The traffic pattern suggests potential scanning or data exfiltration activity. Event ID: e4c3a7b8-9f2c-4d1a-bb5d-8e7f9a1b2c3d.

srcGeoAddress.example: 123 Main Street, San Francisco, CA 94107, United States

destGeoAddress.example: 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043, United States

suggestion.example:
1. Isolate the source host (DESKTOP-7A8B9F3C / 192.168.1.105) from the network immediately.
2. Investigate the host for malware, unauthorized tools, or misconfigurations that could cause the anomalous outbound SSH traffic (appProtocol: ssh).
3. Review firewall logs (deviceName: FW-CORP-ASA-01) for the specific session (eventId: e4c3a7b8-9f2c-4d1a-bb5d-8e7f9a1b2c3d) to confirm the traffic was blocked (dvcAction: blocked) and identify all contacted external destinations (destAddress: 203.0.113.78).
4. Perform a forensic analysis on DESKTOP-7A8B9F3C to determine if data exfiltration (subTechniqueName: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol) occurred.
5. Update firewall baseline rules (ruleName: ASA-Outbound-Traffic-Spike-Detected) to prevent recurrence of this specific anomalous pattern.
6. Consider implementing stricter egress filtering and monitoring for SSH connections to external IPs.
